channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Wi-Fi 8 Is Already Being Tested, and It’s Fast
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.description: Your new router is about to get old.
item.content:encoded: Wi-Fi 7 just got out of the door very recently, but innovation doesn't stop. It's a given that Wi-Fi 8 is already in the works, but you'll be surprised to learn there are actually prototypes in testing already.

item.title: Matter Promised Smart Home Unity, 3 Years Later It's Still a Fragmented Mess
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Pangaro
item.description: Matter was announced in 2022 with the promise of unifying all major smart home ecosystems—but three years later, that promise hasn’t been fulfilled.
item.content:encoded: Matter was supposed to be the savior of the smart home. It was proposed to bring together all major ecosystems—like Google Home, Amazon Alex, Apple HomeKit, and Samsung SmartThings—and make it easier to build your smart home without worrying about which accessories worked with which platform.

item.title: 10 Wild, Weird, and Totally-True Crime Movies
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: These are the movies with true crimes so wild that only a film could encapsulate their surreal nature.
item.content:encoded: True crime has become a major obsession in books, podcasts, and television miniseries. Audiences just can’t get enough of these real stories involving murder, theft, and deception pulled straight from the headlines. Learning more about the evils that lurk within our world has an intoxicating allure.

item.title: Hyundai Achieves Record-Breaking Sales in Q3 2025
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: The Korean brand continues its hot streak as we move towards 2026.
item.content:encoded: Hyundai is on a hot streak in 2025, shattering sales records and solidifying its position as one of the fastest-growing automakers in the world. The brand’s Q3 performance marks a new milestone, driven by strong demand across its SUV, hybrid, and EV lineups. It’s a clear sign that Hyundai’s strategy of blending value, technology, and design is paying off.

item.title: 5 Movies to Stream on Prime Video This Week (October 13 - 19)
item.dc:creator: Chris Snellgrove
item.description: There's always something great to watch if you know where to look. And here are the best movies of yesterday and today you can now stream on Prime!
item.content:encoded: Let’s face it: the better the weekend, the more bitter Monday feels. It can be hard to return to the grind after having a couple of days off. But one thing can make it better—watching a killer movie or two once you get home! And as luck would have it, I’m back to recommend some of my favorite films on Prime Video for you to watch this week.

item.title: Forget Kindle, Here's Why I Use an Android eReader
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heinzman
item.description: You can't take away my freedom.
item.content:encoded: Most eReader brands, including Kindle and Kobo, utilize highly-optimized operating systems with a narrow scope of functionality. They're good products with good software, but they're designed to lock you into a singular storefront and user experience. But I just can't deal with that. So, I bought an Android eReader last September, and I have zero regrets.

item.title: LineageOS 23, Based on Android 16, Is Finally Here
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.description: At a time when the custom ROM scene looks increasingly dire.
item.content:encoded: Custom ROMs still exist, even as you might not be popping into our sister site XDA-Developers to download them as often as you used to do. LineageOS remains one of the most popular projects out there, and now, it's finally getting updated to Android 16—with some notes that reflect just how dire things have gotten.

item.title: 7 Open-Source Apps That Will Let You Cancel Pricey Subscriptions
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Sometimes the best option is free.
item.content:encoded: There’s almost certainly a good open-source alternative for most apps and services you depend on. Not all of them are comparable to paid software, and some require significant setup or technical knowledge, but all are worth considering.

item.title: Why I Install My Steam Games on a Portable SSD
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: Don't leave your old SSDs in the drawer, they want to come out and play.
item.content:encoded: Over the years, the Steam client has become exceptionally flexible when it comes to managing your game files, and that includes game installations on external drives. It's as simple as plugging in your drive, and adding it as a library under the "Storage" section of Steam's settings.

item.title: 7 Tech Products I'd Never Buy Refurbished
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: I guess I have trust issues.
item.content:encoded: I love a good used gadget deal, and I have no issue buying stuff from places like Facebook marketplace for a good bargain, but when it comes to "refurbished" products you're often getting nothing more than an exterior wipe-down of the device and a very limited discount versus buying the same thing new.
